topics.title: Breaking news chaos and building buffers
topics.summary: Upasna describes how breaking news routinely disrupts planned research/user testing with journalists, and why product teams must plan for pivots with backups and buffers.

topics.title: Introduction and Background
topics.summary: Lenny introduces Upasna, her role leading CNN’s CMS for journalists, her work with News Product Alliance, and the episode’s focus on CNN product building and mindfulness.

topics.title: Mindfulness, equanimity, and thriving in chaos
topics.summary: Upasna explains equanimity as a core skill for product in news: pausing before reacting, reducing reactivity, and serving as a calm compass amid constant volatility.

topics.title: When research gets canceled by breaking news
topics.summary: They unpack a common scenario where editors must drop user testing to cover breaking news, and how product teams adapt because journalists are the customers with higher-priority duties.

topics.title: Editorial intake system: demos, sessions, rehearsals, office hours
topics.summary: Upasna details a structured collaboration model with journalists: weekly demo days, collaborative working sessions, breaking-news dress rehearsals, and office hours to gather feedback and build trust.

topics.title: CNN Digital product org and Upasna’s platform role
topics.summary: Upasna explains CNN Digital’s squad-based structure across many product areas and her core-platform team’s mission: rebuild the CMS and onboard the newsroom off the legacy system.

topics.title: OKRs and planning horizons for a long rebuild
topics.summary: They discuss how CNN uses OKRs, planning from multi-year goals down to weekly/daily execution, plus a layered roadmap with team autonomy to choose the approach.

topics.title: Product and design reviews with engineers embedded early
topics.summary: Upasna shares how bringing tech leads and engineers into discovery, user sessions, and design jams improved feasibility decisions and reinforced treating engineers as partners.

topics.title: Remote celebrations and internal evangelism
topics.summary: They talk about morale and rituals on a mostly-remote team, celebrating launches/onboardings with small gift boxes, and the idea of leveraging on-air talent for internal promotion.

topics.title: Sponsor Break
topics.summary: Sponsor read for Vanta and SOC 2 compliance automation, including a listener discount.

topics.title: Balancing features, bugs, and incident response
topics.summary: Upasna explains sprint-by-sprint prioritization, how critical incidents override plans, and how a 24/7 editorial support team triages and escalates issues to product/engineering.

topics.title: Election stress, platform fallbacks, and resilience
topics.summary: Upasna recounts how election coverage demands layered contingency planning and how the new CMS served as a real fallback during the 2020 election—validating stability under pressure.

topics.title: Breaking news dress rehearsals: scripted stress tests
topics.summary: They dive deeper into how rehearsals are scripted end-to-end (email to publish), run in minutes, and observed by engineers/support to ensure the platform can handle real breaking news.

topics.title: High agency under high pressure as a superpower
topics.summary: Upasna reflects on what she’d take to future roles: rapid development and hypothesis testing with reduced risk in a complex system, building a culture of high agency under pressure.

topics.title: Mindful communication: pause, listen, and translate
topics.summary: Upasna shares practical guidance: meditation as foundational, plus mindful communication—listening deeply, pausing before reacting, and speaking in the listener’s language to build trust with editorial.

topics.title: How to start meditating: simple daily presence
topics.summary: Upasna recommends starting small by being fully present during routine activities (like brushing teeth) and suggests Insight Timer as a helpful app, emphasizing simplicity over tools.

topics.title: News Product Alliance and product thinking in newsrooms
topics.summary: Upasna explains why product management in news is still emerging, how resource constraints force journalists into product-like work, and how NPA builds community, resources, and mentorship globally.
